title: Compiler panic

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
This gist has two files: `neuron-broken.rs` and `neuron-working.rs`

https://gist.github.com/michaelmelanson/1f815ca9fea0b9500289c1db4ebf2760

As the name implies, the 'working' one is fine except for a warning about `num_neurons` being lowercase. When I corrected it to `NUM_NEURONS`, I got the 'broken' one which triggers this compiler panic:

```
error: internal compiler error: src/librustc/dep_graph/graph.rs:610: DepNode Hir(7feb039e5ce2b460-c7bd8dd1a29de264) should have been pre-allocated but wasn't.

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:588:9
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace.
error: aborting due to previous error


note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.33.0-nightly (03acbd71c 2019-01-14) running on x86_64-apple-darwin

note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: Could not compile `neuron-opencl`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.33.0-nightly (03acbd71c 2019-01-14)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 03acbd71c977cd63ce5f39ba9b6fe9ffd578785a
commit-date: 2019-01-14
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.33.0-nightly
LLVM version: 8.0
```

Backtrace:

```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:588:9
stack backtrace:
   0:        0x113879fd3 - std::sys::unix::backtrace::tracing::imp::unwind_backtrace::h1be753e13b79693c
```
